title: Can I submit my SAT score without the essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Finally you don't have to take the SAT essay, it is optional now! Some of you might feel happy about it; however, you must not forget that if you decide not to complete the essay component, you might lose on applying to some of the colleges requiring it. For SAT test takers scoring above 22 out of 24 is a really good SAT score to achieve. If you choose to take SAT with essay then you have an option to apply to more schools. Also note that the essay scores will always be sent along with your multiple choice test scores. Colleges and scholarship programs receive only the scores you will send them and you have a SAT score feature for that. Please note that the College Board does not release SAT test scores without student consent.

Yes, of course..!! It is up to you, whether you wanna submit your SAT score with or without the essay. The reason being, every university has a different requirement. Some universities ask for the essay scores whereas others don’t. To know the university requirement, I would suggest you, visit the official websites of your desired universities and check their admission policies and accordingly you can decide. So, submit your scores as per the university requirements otherwise, your application will not be viewed. I hope you got the answer. Note: I am associated with Achievers’ Point.

Yes, you can. All Ivy Leagues have now dropped the essay requirement, whereas Stanford states that the essay is ‘strongly recommended’. Even Duke University ‘strongly recommends’ the essay. The essay is, however, required for the University of California system. As a popular belief, MIT Admissions Officers ‘hate’ the essay and couldn’t care less about it.

Yes, one can submit his SAT score without essay as well but it is always recommended to attempt essay as some universities require the essay score also... so to be at the safer side everyone should attempt essay as in the new SAT(score of 1600) ,the essay score do not affect the rest of your score.

No. While the new SAT score (out of 1600) is not impacted at all by your writing score, colleges still see the writing score that you earned. So whatever you report to the colleges through ScoreChoice, they will still see your writing score.
Yes ofcourse you can submit it Many colleges don’t require essay but i if you give your SAT with essay its an advantage to you as many high colleges recommend essay and for some it is even mandatory
YES - But, if your target college wants you to take SAT / ACT with essay and submit the score, you need to do so.
You merely take the tests that the colleges request that you take, and have those scores submitted.Easy.
Just don’t write it!! You will get a zero for the essay and the essay score does not affect the math and verbal score.
